thread.title: Kenya: Power and Transport Costs Push Up Inflation in June
thread.title_full: Kenya: Power and Transport Costs Push Up Inflation in June

title: Kenya: Power and Transport Costs Push Up Inflation in June
text:
Kenya: State Dismisses Reports on Nairobi Lockdown for Obama's Visit 
"Housing, water, electricity, gas and other fuels index increased by 0.37 per cent mainly due to cost increases in respect of house rents, cooking fuels and other utilities," said KNBS in a statement yesterday. 
The price of a litre of kerosene rose by 4.21 per cent to Sh62.73 from Sh60.20 in May while that of petrol was up to h98.14 from Sh93.76 previously. 
A litre of diesel was sold 4.93 per cent more expensively at Sh84.26 from Sh80.30. Only cooking gas prices dropped over the period by 1.28 per cent to an average cost of Sh2,393 for a 13-kilogramme cylinder. 
The rising rate of inflation and the weak shilling are seen as the main reasons the Central Bank's advisory body- Monetary Policy Commitee - will likely maintain the key lending rate at 10 per cent at its upcoming meeting next Thursday. 
Although there was a decrease in fuel cost adjustment in power bills last month, the cost of electricity remained high because of higher foreign exchange charges due to the weak shilling, KNBS said. Kenya
